intro: Aeollanthus gamwelliae, commonly known as the Gamwell’s aeollanthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a silvery underside that reflects sunlight. Aeollanthus gamwelliae is notable for its delicate, daisy-like blooms that appear in late spring, adding a unique ornamental value to its natural habitat.
